```{r}
#Importing libaries
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
```


```{r}
#reading the data
data <- read.csv("Employers_data.csv", stringsAsFactors = TRUE)
```



```{r}
# Quantitative variables
summary(data$Age)
summary(data$Salary)
```


```{r}
# Categorical variables

table(data$Gender)
table(data$Department)
```


```{r}
# Transforming a variable


data$Salary_thousands <- data$Salary / 1000
summary(data$Salary_thousands)

# Create Age Group variable
data$Age_Group <- ifelse(data$Age < 30, "Young",
                  ifelse(data$Age < 50, "Mid-age", "Senior"))
table(data$Age_Group)


```



```{r}
# Plotting quantitative variable
## Histogram 
ggplot(data, aes(x = Age)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 5, fill = "pink", color = "black") +
  labs(title = "Histogram of Employee Age", x = "Age", y = "Count")
```


```{r}
## Scatterplot of Experience vs Salary
ggplot(data, aes(x = Experience_Years, y = Salary, color = Department)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.6) +
  labs(title = "Experience vs Salary by Department", x = "Experience (Years)", y = "Salary")

```
